domains.name: Deployment and Launch
domains.description: Artifacts and rules that define how the Product is released and made available to users, including environments, deployment execution, validation, operational readiness, monitoring, discoverability, access enablement, and post-launch stabilization.

terms.name: Environment Configuration Specification
terms.definition: A document defining runtime environments (dev/test/stage/prod), their configuration variables, access rules, and environment-specific differences used for deployment and operation.
terms.description: Defines how environments differ, what configuration is required in each, and how environment drift is prevented during release.

terms.name: Infrastructure Specification
terms.definition: A description of infrastructure resources and topology required to run the Product in release environments, including compute, storage, networking, and managed services.
terms.description: Defines the runtime topology and required resources so deployments run reliably and scale under expected launch conditions.

terms.name: Resource Allocation Plan
terms.definition: A plan defining how infrastructure resources and operational capacity are allocated to support deployment, launch load, monitoring, and incident response.
terms.description: Defines capacity allocation and operational coverage required to handle launch activity, performance expectations, and incident handling.

terms.name: Infrastructure Readiness Review
terms.definition: A structured validation confirming infrastructure resources, access, networking, scaling rules, and supporting services are prepared for release.
terms.description: Verifies that infrastructure prerequisites are met and that operational dependencies are available before deployment execution.

terms.name: Deployment Pipeline Specification
terms.definition: A detailed definition of build, test, and deploy automation including triggers, stages, validations, approvals, and environment promotion rules.
terms.description: Defines how code becomes a running system using repeatable automation and quality gates to reduce release risk.

terms.name: Build and Release Steps
terms.definition: A step-by-step procedure describing how artifacts are built, versioned, packaged, and prepared for deployment.
terms.description: Defines how releases are constructed and versioned so deployments are reproducible and traceable.

terms.name: Rollback Strategy
terms.definition: A predefined plan describing how to revert to a safe previous version or configuration when deployment causes failures or critical regressions.
terms.description: Defines how rollback is performed, what triggers it, and what verification occurs after rollback to restore stable operation.

terms.name: Release Execution Plan
terms.definition: A structured runbook defining who executes the release, in which sequence, with checkpoints, communications, and validations.
terms.description: Defines the operational runbook for release so execution is coordinated, auditable, and resilient under unexpected issues.

terms.name: Environment Validation Checklist
terms.definition: A checklist of validations confirming environment configuration, connectivity, permissions, secrets, and dependencies are correct before and after deployment.
terms.description: Defines the minimal environment checks required to confirm correct setup and prevent configuration-related failures.

terms.name: Deployment Validation Results
terms.definition: Recorded outcomes and evidence of deployment validation checks, smoke tests, and health checks performed for a release.
terms.description: Captures evidence that deployment succeeded and that the system is operational and consistent with expected behavior.

terms.name: Operational Readiness Checklist
terms.definition: A checklist validating that monitoring, logging, alerting, incident procedures, access, and support coverage are ready for release and launch.
terms.description: Defines the operational prerequisites required to support stable production use and incident response.

terms.name: Performance Validation Report
terms.definition: A documented summary of performance and load test outcomes compared to performance requirements, including bottlenecks and remediation status.
terms.description: Summarizes whether performance meets target thresholds and identifies performance risks prior to broad launch.

terms.name: Operational Monitoring Plan
terms.definition: A plan defining required metrics, dashboards, health checks, and alert thresholds used to maintain stable operation during and after launch.
terms.description: Defines what is monitored and how issues are detected quickly to protect user experience and system stability.

terms.name: Logging Strategy
terms.definition: A structured definition of what events are logged, log formats, correlation identifiers, retention, and access rules for operational debugging and audit.
terms.description: Defines system-wide logging required for debugging, auditability, and incident investigation during and after launch.

terms.name: Alerting Rules
terms.definition: A set of defined alert conditions and routing rules based on monitoring signals to notify responsible parties of incidents or degradations.
terms.description: Defines when alerts are triggered, how they are routed, and what constitutes actionable incident signals.

terms.name: Incident Preparedness Guidelines
terms.definition: Operational guidelines defining incident classification, response steps, escalation, communication, and post-incident review rules.
terms.description: Defines how incidents are handled so response is coordinated and recovery is consistent under stress.

terms.name: Launch Objectives
terms.definition: Defined measurable goals for the release and initial public availability of the Product.
terms.description: Defines what success means for the launch and what must be achieved at the moment of release to users.

terms.name: Launch Messaging
terms.definition: A defined set of external and internal messages describing what is launching, for whom, and what value it provides, aligned with positioning and value proposition.
terms.description: Defines consistent communication content used during launch so users and stakeholders understand what is available and why it matters.

terms.name: Launch Activities Plan
terms.definition: A structured plan of coordinated actions required to execute the launch, including timing, owners, and dependencies.
terms.description: Defines the operational and coordination actions required to execute launch consistently across teams and systems.

terms.name: User Access Enablement
terms.definition: A specification defining how users obtain access to the Product, including signup, authentication entry points, invitations, gating rules, and prerequisites.
terms.description: Defines how users can start using the product in practice, including access pathways and any rollout gating applied during launch.

terms.name: Onboarding Experience Definition
terms.definition: A specification defining the first-run experience, guidance, empty-state onboarding, and completion criteria for initial user activation.
terms.description: Defines how first-time users are guided to first success, reducing confusion and improving activation at launch.

terms.name: Search Engine Accessibility
terms.definition: A set of technical rules ensuring the product is crawlable and indexable by search systems, including routing, robots directives, and page accessibility constraints.
terms.description: Defines how pages are exposed to search systems and which parts are indexable, preventing accidental invisibility or unintended exposure.

terms.name: Metadata and Structured Data Specification
terms.definition: A specification defining page metadata and structured data including titles, descriptions, canonical URLs, Open Graph, and schema.org markup where applicable.
terms.description: Defines how pages represent themselves to search and social systems to improve discoverability and consistent previews.

terms.name: Product Promotion Channels
terms.definition: A defined list of supported distribution and promotion channels used to direct users to the Product at launch, such as direct links, email distribution, marketplaces, or internal distribution.
terms.description: Defines which channels are used to bring users to the product and what technical or operational support each channel requires.

terms.name: Launch Distribution Plan
terms.definition: A plan defining how users are routed to the Product during launch, including rollout sequencing, gating, traffic expectations, and channel coordination.
terms.description: Defines how distribution happens in practice, including sequencing and constraints needed to maintain stability while scaling access.

terms.name: Early-Life Support Plan
terms.definition: A plan defining how issues are handled immediately after launch, including staffing coverage, triage rules, communication, and stabilization priorities.
terms.description: Defines post-launch operational support and stabilization actions to ensure user-impacting issues are handled quickly.

terms.name: Operational Report
terms.definition: A post-launch report summarizing operational performance, incidents, metrics, and observed issues over a defined period.
terms.description: Summarizes what happened after launch, including stability, incidents, and performance signals to guide stabilization and improvements.

terms.name: Release Documentation
terms.definition: A structured set of documents describing release content, changes, known issues, operational notes, and user-visible updates.
terms.description: Defines what changed and what to expect, supporting user communication, support, and operational handover.
